definition: detour/long way around
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: You have made your way around this hill country long enough; now turn north.
sentences.chinese: 你们绕行这山的日子够了，要转向北去。

sentences.english: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
sentences.chinese: 他们晚上转回，叫号如狗，围城绕行。

sentences.english: No Through Route For Pedestrians Detour.
Ye have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you northward.
sentences.chinese: 你们绕行这山的日子够了，要转向北去。

sentences.english: It is quickest to walk across the field -- going round by road takes much longer .
sentences.chinese: 穿过田地路途最近绕行公路要远得多。

sentences.english: Circumambulation of the holy places is an act of devotion and love.
sentences.chinese: 圣地绕行是一种处于敬拜和爱慕的行为。

sentences.english: The tourist train ran around the factory, Suan-Tou Station.
sentences.chinese: 蒜头糖厂绕行厂区的观光列车。

sentences.english: When bicycles ahead obstruct the traffic flow, the driver may honk to remind them, speed up and bypass.
sentences.chinese: 自行车影响通行时，可鸣喇叭提示，加速绕行。

sentences.english: Circumambulating the Stupa has to be done clockwise.
sentences.chinese: 绕行舍利塔必须顺时针方向被做。

sentences.english: The system shall be able to display the elapsed time for the car to make one circuit around the track.
sentences.chinese: 系统应能显示车沿跑道绕行一圈花费的时间。

sentences.english: They return at evening, snarling like dogs, and prowl about the city.
sentences.chinese: 他们晚上转回，叫号如狗，围城绕行。

sentences.english: I had just circumnavigated the entire country.
sentences.chinese: 我刚可是绕行这个国家一大圈了。

sentences.english: The format for elapsed time display shall be hh:mm:ss.
sentences.chinese: 绕行时间的显示格式应为hh:mm:ss。

sentences.english: My heart all the people you can see only a detour.
sentences.chinese: 涐旳用心所有旳亽都能看到只有迩一个绕行了。

sentences.english: The main road was flooded so we had to go round by narrow country lanes .
sentences.chinese: 公路干线遭水淹没，我们只得择乡间小径绕行。

sentences.english: Earth's rotation and the Moon's orbit are both counter-clockwise here.
sentences.chinese: 地球的自转和月亮的绕行都是逆时针方向。

definition: to go by a roundabout route/to take a detour/(medicine or civil engineering) bypass
to go through/to pass through/to be in general use
to make a detour/to take the long route
to change route/to divert (a road or a watercourse)
to turn left
to turn right
freeway ramp
to go straight/straight forward/fig. to do right
(of a car, ship, train etc) to enter
abbr. for 立體交叉|立体交叉[li4 ti3 jiao1 cha1] overpass
to pass through/via/by way of
crossing/intersection (of roads)
tone (of voice)/tune
variant of 掉頭|掉头[diao4 tou2]
traffic lane/driveway
northward/facing north
to pass by/menstruation
